About Yoder and Frey Auction

Yoder & Frey is a well established firm of auctioneers and asset management specialists with offices in Holland, Ohio and auction facilities in Kissimmee, Florida and Darlington, Pennsylvania. The company was founded in 1964, and specialises is the sale of machinery and heavy construction equipment, tractors, trucks and trailers for clients such as private companies and individuals, banks, insurance agencies and financiers. Yoder Auctioneer is a member of several trade organisations including the North American Auctioneers Association and the Florida Auctioneers Association, and makes use of extensive local, national and international knowledge and experience to organise sales for a wide range of clients.

Services Tailored to Client's Needs

Yoder and Frey are committed to creating efficient asset disposal solutions for clients that are suited to their individual requirements. Whether sellers wish to auction one piece of equipment, or whether they are downsizing, relocating or disposing of a complete inventory, the Yoder Auction can take care of every aspect of the sales process. Yoder & Frey employ a professional team that collectively has many years of experience in sales and auctions, and is able to assist clients in selecting the best option. Yoder and Frey conducts several types of auctions from its sales sites in Florida and Pennsylvania and its annual February Consignment Auction in Kissimmee attracts buyers from all over the world. The auction is one of the major dates in the construction sector calendar and has now been taking place for over 40 years.

Buying Made Easy 

New bidders and international customers who wish to participate in the February Consignment Auction in Kissimmee Florida or other auctions conducted by the firm are required to register in advance of the sale. They must also lodge a refundable deposit of $10,000 with Yoder & Frey or provide a letter of guarantee from a recognised US bank. The company also conducts sales throughout the year via its own online portal and in conjunction with several vendors who each have their own registration requirements. Prospective buyers who wish to bid in online auctions should consult the company's website and complete the online registration process in good time before the start of specific sales. Once registered, buyers can participate in Yoder & Frey online auctions from any location at any time. Detailed instructions for both live and online bidding and registration and procedures can be found on the Yoder Auction web page, where information on upcoming sales is also listed. Would be buyers then have access to a wide selection of high quality used vehicles, equipment and machinery from the construction and heavy industry sector, including hard to find items and exclusive machinery. The February Consignment Sale in Kissimmee, Florida regularly features large lots of equipment from well known brands such as excavators by Caterpillar and the sale has up to 5 rings on certain days.

About Thimbleby and Shorland

Thimbleby & Shorland is a firm of auctioneers, valuers, real estate agents and chartered surveyors that was founded in 1901 in Reading, Berkshire. TSAuction specialized in livestock, horse sales and agricultural auctions, but has diversified over the years to include a huge range of goods. Thimbleby & Shorland offer clients a range of services that includes appraisals, valuations and asset disposal and can conduct sales at their Reading headquarters or at the sellers own site or premises. For the past 25 years Thimbleby company has acted as agents for local and national Liquidators and Receivers, and also act as agents for the Reading Official Receiver and other local government offices.

Specialised Sales That Attract an International Clientele

Thimbleby & Shorland employ a professional team with specific experience in unique sectors such as livestock, vintage carriages or horses, enabling the company to offer solutions that fit the needs of sellers and buyers from a variety of backgrounds. The twice yearly auctions of Shetland ponies are the largest in the UK, and attract buyers from all over Europe and further afield. Thimbleby also conducts sales of heavy horses, horse brasses and farm implements on a regular basis which have a large international following.

Regular Auctions of a Vast Range of Goods

As well as important livestock sales which take place once or twice each year, Thimbleby Shorland also organise many auctions of horses & ponies, saddlery, antiques, home and office furniture and equipment, computers, cars, vintage goods, vintage and commercial vehicles and other industrial goods and memorabilia each month. Heavy construction machinery and plant is also disposed of by Thimbleby & Shorland at sales that are organised with clients such as Hewden Plant Hire. Unique and unusual lots are often featured in the company's general sales, such as the recent auction of a collection of books from 1900 to 1920 and the complete contents of a commercial hair & beauty salon. Prospective buyers need to register in order to bid at Thimbleby & Shorland auctions, and a refundable deposit is required for sales of vehicles, plant and equipment such as the Hewden Auction. Registration can be completed at the auction office prior to sales and a bidder number will then be allocated. TSAuctions also sells small goods such as hand tools in quick online sales that are created in conjunction with partner companies such as Speedy Auctions. There are details of upcoming events in the Calendar section of the Thimbleby & Shorland website, and subscribers can choose to be informed of TS auctions of interest by e mail. The web page also provides detailed information of current and previous sales, entry forms for sellers, catalogues and up to date news of successful Thimbleby and Shorland events and developments within the company.

About Escrapalia

Escrapalia is an online auction site based in Madrid created by Surus Inversa, a Spanish specialist in reverse logistics that manages assets for companies from all parts of the country. Due to the unique nature of its business, Surus established Escrapalia in order to give clients an efficient and cost effective way to dispose of surplus assets, and to bring their goods to the attention of a larger pool of potential buyers. Escrapalia uses its online sales platform to provide buyers with access to a vast range of materials, goods and equipment in a simple and transparent manner. The company has extensive stock reserves that are updated each week, and which offer buyers goods at more competitive rates than those found via traditional retail channels.

Escrapalia have Clients from a range of sectors

Escrapalia conducts regular online sales and auctions and re-sells used and surplus goods for clients ranging from small and medium sized enterprises to large multinational concerns. It offers sellers a chance to maximise profits on scrap or surplus, end of line and clearance items, and has a professional team on hand to deal with each step of the process. Escrapalia provides clients with a comprehensive range of services and aims to find solutions that are tailored to their individual needs. The company can deal with projects of any size and makes use of its large database of international customers to target potential buyers for specialised machinery, stock and equipment.

A simple process for buyers

All buyers must register on the company's web page in order to bid at online auctions organised by Escrapalia. Registration is free and is open to individuals as well as to trade professionals and businesses. The company sells disposal lots for clients in all fields, and buyers can find ships and boats, aviation equipment, agricultural machinery, electronic equipment, household and office equipment, specialist industrial machinery and hardware and abrasives among the vast range of goods regularly featured in auctions on the online portal. Website users are able to see goods listed by category as well as a list of auctions in specific areas of Spain. Auctions can be live events or timed online sales, and all lots can be purchased by bidding on the Escrapalia website. Forthcoming events and current auctions are clearly shown on the web page, and buyers can also see lots that are available for direct sale. Along with Surus, Escrapalia counts Metis Pac and Government Liquidation Inc. among its professional partners.

About British Car Auctions

British Car Auctions Ltd began trading as Southern Counties Car Auctions in Farnham, Surrey in 1946. Over the years the company has grown from a concern that sold 14 cars at its first auction into a thriving business that sells up 12,000 vehicles per week in live and online auctions. British Car Auctions is now part of the BCA Europe group, the largest used vehicle sales business in Europe. The company was one of the first in Europe to offer its customers a complete range of cars that ranged from from budget vehicles to luxury cars, and it has up to 10,000 cars available for sale at any given time which gives great results.

A comprehensive range of services for sellers and buyers

British Car Auction hosts regular live sales as well as a range of ongoing online events, and sellers can opt to sell one car or an entire fleet of vehicles. As well as private cars, the company regularly sells ex-driving school vehicles and commercial vehicles including buses and vans. Sellers are able to reach a wider pool of buyers thanks to British Car Auctions online portal, and a 'Sure Sale' feature ensures that their vehicle will be sold. British Car Auctions offers the biggest selection of used cars in the UK, and buyers can either visit one of the company's auction centres or buy online. Live sales take place in the company's 19 UK auction centres which are located in various cities such as London, Manchester, Edinburgh or Birmingham. Results are later published online.

Advantages for buyers with BCA

Details of upcoming events are given on the British Car Auctions website, and a monthly auction catalogue can be downloaded to browse vehicles for sale at each auction. In order to browse cars online website users need to register. The registration process takes just a few seconds and is open to private individuals as well as dealers and trade professionals. To buy cars online an application form has to be completed, and once accepted buyers are able to bid efficiently and securely from any location. A MyBCA card that ranges from blue entry level to platinum is available to Motor Trade buyers, and discounts and offers are based on the number of vehicles purchased each year. Website users can choose to receive a regular newsletter from British Car Auctions Limited, and extra features such as the BCA Showroom highlight some of the company's most prestigious luxury cars or unusual vehicles like horseboxes or motor homes. Other services offered by the company include a vehicle preparation service for sellers and a delivery option for successful bidders.

EX-FACTORY Inc. was founded in Charlotte, North Carolina in 1989. The company imports and deals in new and used woodworking machinery, metalworking machinery, plastics machinery and stone processing equipment. EX-FACTORY also offers its clients a complete appraisal, valuation and asset management service and organises regular auctions and liquidation sales. The company operates throughout the US and Canada, and has extensive connections and sales links in Mexico, South America, Central America and overseas.

A vast database of machinery

EXFACTORY represents companies of any size who wish to capitalise on unwanted or unused stock or machinery, and its appraisal and asset disposal services are used by clients such as CITICORP and BANK of AMERICA. A database of over 6,000 machines for sale enables buyers to source specialised equipment more easily, and archives list over 35,000 items that have been offered for sale by EX-FACTORY Auctions since 1991. The company's key team of professional sales personnel each has between 3 to 7 years of industry experience, and multilingual staff are fluent in several languages such as Spanish, German and French.

Advising clients from the US and further afield

It's in depth experience of the national and international woodworking and metalworking fields allows EX-FACTORY to assist clients in Canada, the US and overseas. It is ideally placed to advise on solutions such as sale or purchase, liquidation or EX-FACTORY auction. A freight department is able to assist buyers with shipping and transport, while a dedicated technical team can disconnect, fit and install equipment in some areas. In conjunction with its partner companies, EX-FACTORY can also offer leasing and finance options, and an instant appraisal service means that would be sellers can get an immediate online valuation on their machines.

Making purchases easy

EXFACTORY Auctions features over 90 separate categories on its website, enabling users to easily find the machinery they want. A team of experienced Product Managers can advise clients on different categories such as agricultural machinery or electrical components, and contact details are supplied. Buyers are able to source new and used machines efficiently via the EXFACTORY website, and an 'act now' button enables them to ask for quotes, lease machinery or buy. After registering for an account on the company's website, users can buy used and new equipment, including EX-FACTORY woodworking machinery, list their own used equipment for sale without charge and be informed by e mail of news, events, offers and updates.

• Founded:  1902
  • Headquarters: Vancouver, Canada
  • Offices in Canada, US, Germany, Japan & China
  • Divisions: Industrial, Retail, Fine Art & Antiques,

About Maynards Auction

Maynards is known for offering premier asset auctioning and valuation services for over a 100 years now. Established in 1902, the firm opened its first office in Vancouver, Canada. Today, it specialises in commercial and industrial equipment sales all around the world. Ever since it was founded, Maynards showed exceptional expertise in asset sales in most sectors. The small Canadian firm soon gained global repute, and they set up offices in Europe, the United States, China and Japan. With eight permanent offices around the world, Maynards Industries Ltd handles projects worth up to half a billion dollars.

History meets innovation

Having been in the auctioneering and asset liquidation industry for over a century, Maynards Auctions has developed several tried and tested ways of ensuring that their clients get the best possible results, every time. Firstly, Maynards Industries makes optimum use of its wide network of contacts. These contacts comprise of industry specialists who bring expertise from a variety of industrial sectors. They offer project-specific insights that give the company an extra edge on each event. Secondly, Maynards Auctioneer has a team of highly experienced project managers who develop workable sales strategies for every event. Whether it is a public auction or a private treaty, these managers design a game plan that ensures that the event draws the right buyers and fetches the best possible value. And finally, the firm prides itself on taking care of every aspect of the sale, right from marketing and planning to consignment management and transportation. These factors, combined with the first-hand knowledge that only comes from being in the industry for so long, help Maynards Auction achieve the results that have brought them international renown.

The Maynards expertise

Though Maynards auction house is well able to take on projects from almost every industrial sector, Maynards specialises in automotive asset auctions. Since 2005, they have fetched more than $250 million in used auto equipment sales - including auto parts - for their clients. Their list of clients in this sector is impressive too. They look after projects for companies like Toyota, Ford and Nissan Bosch. Moreover, Maynards Canada has been named the only asset recovery specialist for the automotive giants, General Motors and Chrysler North America. Apart from this, other areas of expertise include sales in biopharma, sawmill, woodworking, printing and milling equipment. This experience, expertise and the involvement in optimising the results for each project make Maynards Industries one of the most reputed auction and appraisal company in the world today.

• HQ: Aartselaar, Belgium
  • CEO: Christophe Moyersoen
  • AoY Rating: 4.3 of 5
  • www.moyersoen.be
     

The Belgian auction house Moyersoen N.V. is a specialist for the handling of liquidations, warehouse liquidation sales and professional industrial asset liquidation. The enterprise is run by Nancy Eyckmans and owned by Christophe MOYERSOEN who, together with their team of 30 employees address the complete range of services.

Industrial asset liquidator with profound know-how 

With more than 30 years of experience the auction house Moyersoen is able to serve approximately 5,000 visitors and clients from 94 countries on a daily basis. Moyersoen takes care of inventories, cataloging, valuations and the liquidation of a wide variety of different assets. In 1980, Christophe Moyersoen started to work as industrial asset liquidator and based on that experience he started his own enterprise five years later. In the beginning, he focused his efforts on the development of good cooperation with trustees regarding the professional handling of bankruptcies and later he also worked with leasing companies, banks and other financial institutions. He then expanded his range of services to the liquidation of immovable properties from insolvencies. The motivated team at Moyersoen consists of appraisers and experts working on behalf of courts, lawyers, liquidators, auditors and tax accountants. Special focus is given to transactions based on the profitable offload of surplus goods, such as machinery or material, from the reorganization of companies.

Moyersoen Diverse services  

The inventory and creation of catalogs are serving the best possible advertisement of the respective Moyersoen auctions and are considered part of the work at Moyersoen just as much as the professional transaction of the auction, the transparent billing and the final settlement of costs with the different clients. If it is impossible to publicly auction off all available movables, Moyersoen can resort to a comprehensive customer database in order to quickly realize an attractive result. For that particular purpose, Moyersoen regularly uses its storage capacities for clearance sales as quick and efficient results can be realized more easily for the different clients. Collaboration with trustees takes on an important role because of the comprehensive experience in the transaction of bankruptcies. As appraisers appointed by the court, the Moyersoen auction house appraises movable assets with regard to their continuation, acquisition or liquidation. In detailed consultation with its clients, Moyersoen develops the best liquidation strategies and consequently implements them so the creditors receive the maximum proceeds. The auction house also includes stocks, parts of enterprises, machines and business equipment into the professional liquidation service and regularly achieves excellent results. Another professional business segment at the Moyersoen auction house is the successful auction of vehicles.

Moyersoen Auction Portfolio

Moyersoen is involved in the liquidation of machines and industrial plants as well as business equipment and stocks of companies from all sectors. Furthermore, Moyersoen online auctions include different vehicles as well as immovable property from insolvencies.

Article writen by ''De Tjid''

• Founded in  1997
  • Located in Göttingen
  • Auctioneer of the Year Ranking 3 of  5 Sternen
  • Website: proventura.de
     

Since the foundation in 1997, PROVENTURA Industrie-Auktion GmbH has developed into a company that operates in different locations in Germany: Göttingen, Berlin, Hanover, Braunschweig, Halle (Saale). The team around the managing director Marcel Deppe B.A. can act fast directly on site if required.

The German market as a priority

The auction house works with liquidators, credit  institutions, leasing companies, tax offices, courts and  individual clients from all over Western Europe, with a special focus on the German speaking countries. In addition to its headquarters, Proventura is located in Hanover and Heiligenhaus (Düsseldorf), Berlin and Grabenstätt / Bavaria and faces its task with a workforce of eight full timeemployees, four of them as appraisers and auctioneers. The sole shareholder of Proventura Industrie-Auktion GmbH is Dip.- eng. Johann Zimmermann from the Chamber of Industry and Commerce in Hanover. Astrid Graf, Roland Müller and Dip.- eng. Johann Zimmermann are the general directors of Proventura. Its services include appraisals of movable assets from all economic sectors, clearance sales in retail, seizures and auctions for companies of all sizes. Items can be stored at the auctioneer's warehouses in three different regions in Germany. With more than 2,000 inventories created and more than 700 companies sold by auction or marketed for the highest bid, Proventura online knows the German market very well and has specialized in inexpensive public auctions for small, mid-size and large companies.

Public auctions for a large audience

The return for the client is a lot higher in public auctions on Proventura than in usual sales. High-quality auctions provide the necessary base for buyers to fully inform themselves with the lots. Online auctions are divided into different categories, among them construction, metalworking, woodworking, machinery and tools. All auctions are equipped with color photo catalogues and presentations online, email notifications for registered users as well as advertisements in newspapers and journals. Among the closed online auctions involving entire plants or parts of a company were Gebhard GmbH for metalworking machinery, porta design GmbH for machinery from the aluminum and plastic industry and Tischlerei Uwe Stein for woodworking machines. Online auctions have a 30 seconds rule, which implies that any online auction will be prolonged for 30 seconds, if a bid has been made within the last minute before closing. In order to provide up to date information on finished, running and planned auctions, the website is regularly updated with all necessary information. Every month, approximately 85,000 people from all over the world view auctions on the Proventura online website.

• Location Hamburg
  • Online Since 2000
  • ADJ Ranking 4 of 5 Stars
     

Dechow GmbH is one of the largest auction houses and used sellers in Germany offering a comprehensive range of professional services in used industrial machinery sector for its local and international clients and customers.

Dechow A European-based Used Seller & Auction House

The company's rich history spans over the century from its establishment in 1904 till the present day where the company remains well established within both traditional on-site and online used machinery auction sectors. From its establishment, Dechow auctions went a long way and along has managed to complete thousands of successful transactions in Germany and across Europe and gain first-hand expertise in various fields of the industry. Today the company is able to offer its customers highly professional services closely engaging in in-depth analysis, expert advice, and development of creative concepts. The company closely cooperates with numerous insolvency practitioners, banks and leasing companies around Germany and through its strong presence in the local market, with eight nationwide branches and headquarters in Hamburg, Dechow is able to offer fast, reliable and consistent services. Additionally, through its partnership agreements and subsidiaries the auctioneer has established a strong presents in close by markets such as Austria, Hungary and Spain.

Through its modern online platform, Dechow offers a wide range of used products. The most assortment on the website is comprised of used industrial machinery and plant equipment such as used metal processing machinery, cranes, woodworking machines, office equipment and many more, which is presented in simple visually rich way to make bidding and buying process as simple and easy as possible. Besides industrial machinery the company also offers real estate and business for sale to further diversify its offer.

Dechow Auctions - Diversification and recognized quality

In order to better meet the diverse needs of international clients and constantly monitor their own standards, Dechow auctions constantly engage in improving a professional quality management and implementing new practises related with it. The auctioneer's effort in quality management has been recognised by the German Technical Inspection Association and has been awarded with international quality standard certificate. Beyond German borders Dechow is also recognised by its successful collaboration with the largest Austrian construction company Alpine.

Dechow strategic focus, well recognised constant quality improvement and high expertise ranging within different business sectors and industries make the company well positioned among local and international competitors in industrial auction market and promises a long business future that lies ahead of the company.

About Höchsmann GmbH

The auction house Höchsmann is located in Klipphausen, Germany and was founded in the mid 1960's. It specializes on machines, plants and tools for the wood working industry. More than 45 employees work under the management of business owner Stefan Höchsmann and his general manager Mathias Tempel and deal with a broad range of services focused on liquidations.

Experts in the wood working industry

The original founder, Leopold Höchsmann, initially focused on the development of modern wood working machines and tools. Stefan Höchsmann, however, split up the company in 1998 and established the new company in trading second-hand machines for the wood working industry. Many years of experience in this field become apparent when viewing the broad range of services that reaches far beyond simply offering products. Potential buyers can choose whether they want to take over used machines, plants and tools in the actual state or whether they want to trust in the professional review and maintenance by the company's experts. The professional appraisal does not only serve the potential buyer but also the seller who can later refer to the market-conform results. Hoechsmann also ensures the professional dismantling, transport, extensive review and repair as well as the assembly and startup operations of machines and plants at the location of the client. Hochsmann's network of clients and customers tremendously grew over the years and allows the auction house now quick and profitable liquidations on behalf of its manifold clients that are recruited from among banks and bankruptcy trustees but also from companies.

Know-how and IT, a perfect synergy

A very special feature of Höchsmann GmbH for everyone interested in wood working is its encyclopedia WOOD TEC PEDIA, a comprehensive wood working lexicon, as well as its relevant directory of manufacturers. Both are accessible on the company's website. The online platform also presents the auctions via WOOD TED AUCTION and potential customers find all important information well categorized. On the one hand Höchsmann auctions are presented according to their date and on the other hand there is a catalog of all available machines. A search function helps in finding individual machine types and a filter for the individual items ready for liquidation can be found, too. The auction house Höchsmann is active beyond the German borders and the various language options on the website do not keep that a secret for long. A special highlight for all clients is the auction house's purchase offer, since it makes it possible to quickly and transparently offload entire machine parks.

The auction house Epic Auctions B.V. in Eindhoven was only founded in the end of 2013 and it enters the market with major dedication and commitment. In 2014, four auctions are planned with a special focus on the construction industry, in particular on earthworks and civil engineering.

All-round service and know-how

In order to distinguish itself from other companies in this branch of industry, Epic-Auctions aims to utilize the profound skills and great experience of its employees in various industries as well as on the national and international markets. Their expert knowledge allows for explicit descriptions and advertisements of the auction lots aimed at a target audience so that all liquidation results can be highly optimized. The first auction took place in May 2014 and finished a big success. EpicAuctions specializes on cranes, bulldozers, loaders, construction elevators, tractors and diggers but also trucks, trailers, scaffolds and other construction equipment. Covering this very specific niche in the work of auction houses, Epic Auctions aims to develop as a special auctioneer with competence and know-how.

Auction house for the construction industry

The online platform of the auction house is aligned with the various categories of the target industries, such as construction, agriculture, transport, tools, forklift trucks and tractors. The construction machines, equipment and tools for the auctions can be presented on the premises of the company where successful buyers can also pick up their purchase after the finished auction. Since any payment is done with the help of a service provider Epic-Auctions can proudly reference complete transparency in its workings. The auction rules are clearly defined and the next big auction is planned for September.

About KVD Kvarndammen

The Swedish auction house KVD Kvarndammen AB has its headquarters in Gothenburg and with a specialization in vehicles of all kind it is one of Scandinavia's leading online auctioneers. Each week, several hundred used cars, heavy vehicles, machinery and other objects are sold by KVD Auctions to private and business buyers from Scandinavia, Northern Europe and the rest of the world. The auction house, listed by Ratos, a market-listed private equity company, was founded in 1991 and employs approximately 180 people (2014)

 


 
  • Founded: 1991
  • Headquarters: Kungälv, Sweden
  • 14 sites in Sweden & Norway
  • AoY Rating: 0 of 5
  • Website: kvdauctions.com

Profound know-how regarding appraisals and liquidations

With more than 30,000 auctions annually, Kvarndammen can easily consider itself one of the leading broker services in Scandinavia. KVD Auction has qualified teams at fourteen auction sites and clients can initially receive professional appraisals of their potential auction lots and they can then have their items included in the strictly organized procedure of the company. Two internet platforms address on the one hand the Swedish audience and on the other international clients that seek to investigate the several hundred weekly auctions of all kinds of vehicles, boats, machines and plants as well as office and business equipment. Clients at KVD include banks and leasing companies, but also automobile fleet managers, companies and municipalities. In addition, KVD Kvarndammen works with large insurance companies and public authorities that aim to renew their car fleet. Of particular expertise are appraisals done by KVD's own appraisal company KVD Bilpriser AB. In this regard, the company also includes stocks, such as equity stakes, in their appraisals and the KVD group does not rely solely on its on database and statistics but cooperates with a whole network of specialists.

Here you can find KVD head office adress

Online presence with a Scandinavian orientation

The online platforms of the auction house Kvarndammen can be accessed in English (on kvdauctions.com), Norwegian (on kvdnorge.no) and of course Swedish (on kvd.se). International clients, too, can hence be fully informed regarding all auction lots. KVDAuctions is designed in a way that auctions are transparently displayed according to individual product categories that take place on the individual days. Automobile auctions, for example, take place from Monday to Thursday plus Sunday, boats and RVs every Wednesday and machines every Wednesday and Thursday. Even though vehicles of all kind are the primary focus of KVD Kvarndammen AB, other items – such as machines and plants from various industries – are also included in the auction lots. Potential buyers can view the vehicles and machines on-site and trust in high-quality appraisals before the KVD auction. The terms and conditions for every auction are clearly communicated so that clients and prospective customers alike can have all their questions answered beforehand.

Ritchie Bros. - trusted as the world's leading global equipment marketplace

Ritchie Bros. is a global asset management and disposition company, offering customers end-to-end solutions for buying and selling used heavy equipment, trucks and other assets. We help thousands of people around the world appraise, sell, inspect, buy, refurbish, ship and finance heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide because we make buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent.

Who we are

  • Established 1958 in Kelowna, BC, Canada
  • Headquartered in Vancouver, BC, Canada
  • USA head office in Lincoln, NE; European head office in Breda, the Netherlands
  • 40 permanent auction sites in North America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Australia
  • Publicly traded on NYSE and TSX: RBA
  • 2,200+ full-time employees worldwide

What we do

  • We help our customers buy and sell a wide range of used and unused equipment for:
  • Construction
  • Mining
  • Transportation
  • Agriculture
  • Oil & gas
  • Lifting & material handling
  • Forestry & other industries

How we do it

With our global network, including 40 permanent auction sites around the world and operations in 15+ countries, Ritchie Bros. sells billions of dollars of heavy equipment and trucks each year via our multiple selling platforms including:

Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers

Unreserved public auctions with onsite and online bidding at 40 permanent auction sites & temporary locations

Marketplace-E

A 24/7 online equipment marketplace oﬀering more control over transactions with multiple price and timing options

Mascus

About Tiger Auctions

Tiger Remarketing Services is part of the Tiger Group, a privately owned company that provides a wide range of valuation - via Tiger Valuation Services -, appraisal, advisory, restructuring and auction services to clients in the retail, wholesale and industrial sectors. With over 40 years of experience, Tiger Capital Group helps clients to convert unused or surplus assets into capital through organised auctions and sales that are available to a worldwide audience. The company has offices in Los Angeles, New York and Boston in the USA as well as subsidiary concerns in the Asia Pacific region.

Tiger Auctions geared to clients needs

The Tiger Group offer sellers a complete appraisal and disposition service and a viable and efficient way to reach a larger pool of potential bidders. A professional expert is on hand to assist at every step, and Tiger Auction has been involved in large scale closure and clearance projects for clients in retail, commerce, wholesale, chemicals, engineering, construction and electronics. Tiger Group's buyers can purchase complete turn key operations, specialised machinery and equipment, shop & factory fixtures and fittings, vehicles, heavy construction equipment, music and sound equipment, as well as surplus stock from a wide selection of sources.

Tiger Capital Group LLC aims to combine market experience with an internet focused approach. Live, online and webcast auctions enable sellers to maximise profits and offer buyers the opportunity to bid for specialised equipment from anywhere in the world. Registration is free on TigerGroup and both buyers and sellers benefit from a transparent and easy to use service.

About 1st Machinery

1st Machinery Auctions Limited is based in Coventry in the English Midlands. The company has long experience in the auction of used machine tools in the UK, with annual sales of more than £10 million.

A long-established business

1st Machinery Auctions was formed by the merger of two well-established firms working in this sector. Together, these two companies bring more than 130 years of experience to 1st Machinery Auctions Ltd. The company is frequently used by UK finance companies and liquidators to raise the best prices for used machine tools and has contacts both in the UK and abroad to realise the best prices. The general manager is Richard Tomlinson and the company says that “integrity, discretion and professionalism” are among key qualities.

Offering a variety of auction formats online

First Machinery Auctions offers its technical abilities as well as its auction know-how to customers. Private treaty and tender sale are both offered as well as outright purchase, where funds are available straight away. A commission auction is another option and 1st Machinery Auction customers can also opt for a guaranteed auction, with a certain amount of return guaranteed to the seller.

Here is a list of top auctioneers and traders in the United Kingdom.

Superfast Auction is based in the Czech Republic where Michal Eichlar and an experienced team provide a range of services for buyers and sellers of transport vehicles, construction equipment and agricultural machinery. The company was established in the Prague area following its founders many years of experience overseas, and aims to find fast and efficient solutions for clients from a wide selection of backgrounds.

High quality heavy vehicles and machinery

Superfast s.r.o. helps buyers to offload their unused assets quickly via regular auctions at its large complex in the Czech Republic. Specialising in popular brands like VOLVO, MERCEDES and JCB, Superfast Auction is able to arrange appraisal, transportation and advertising, and its website lists each category separately. Buyers need to register to get a personal number that will enable them to bid, but the process is simple and takes just a few minutes. Those looking for specific vehicles or machinery will find that sale lists on SuperfastAuction's webpage give a clear overview, and each auction is also listed by date.
Superfast Auction arrange large auctions that bring buyers and sellers together without intermediaries, and offer a full pick up or delivery service if required. Buyers can find buses, cars, diggers and heavy construction equipment as well as lorries and trucks, and the company also holds regular spare parts sales.

Perfection Industrial Sales specialises in the sale of used machinery and industrial assets via its live and online auctions. The company was founded as Perfection Machinery Sales in Illinois, USA in 1963. In recognition of its clients changing needs it developed three separate but fully linked sectors over the years - Perfection Machinery Sales, Perfection Investment Recovery and Perfection Industrial Sales. Perfection Industrial Sales offers a wide range of buying, selling and remarketing services, and over 48 years of experience enables the company to tailor solutions to the specific needs of its clients.

A plan for every client

Perfection Industrial Sales is committed to finding the right solution or plan for each customer and will take care of every step from initial assessment to auction. Live and online auctions allow both sellers and prospective buyers to benefit from a simple and transparent process, and Perfection Industrial Sales has experience in a vast range of sectors including Aerospace, Gas & Oil, Construction, Plastics and Steelworks. Some of the services that clients can take advantage of include equipment appraisals, used machinery auctions and surplus asset management.

Acess to a wide range of sales and auctions

Those wishing to bid for machinery or equipment in auctions or liquidation sales need to create an account with Perfection Industrial. This can be done easily on the company's website and is free and open to anyone. Once an account has been established, website users can register to participate in regular live and online sales and auctions and can sign up for alerts and updates. Some of the company's successful past auctions and liquidations have included an online auction of MUSAHI autoparts and a closure sale in the form of a live auction and webcast for a plastics recycling plant. Buyers can find all types of industrial equipment and machinery and are able to bid from any location, while sellers have access to a far larger customer base. Perfection Industrial Sales features current and upcoming events on its website, along with details of lots and times and dates for online auctions.

Barliant Auctions is an American specialist in liquidation auctions. Barliant Auctions is based in the city of Sandwich in the state of Illinois. The company says that it is an asset recovery specialist. The parent company, Barliant & Co, has been in business since 1937. The company's president is Scot S. Swanson.

A proven way of working

Barliant Auction works with bankers, lawyers, trustees and companies which rapidly need cash. The key to its business is its long-established appraisal service, which is offered both to healthy companies in need of cash, and in cases of liquidation or bankruptcy. Its experts have experience of working in a wide variety of industries, such as woodworking, food, metalworking and contracting. Barliant will draw up a detailed valuation through making an inventory of assets for each individual client.

Auctions throughout North America

Barliant Auctions has conducted hundreds of auctions at business locations all over the United States. Many of the auctions are in the food sector, and packing companies are another speciality. Some auctions have been held in Canada and Mexico. Online bidding is generally available through proxy sites, and online bidders must register in advance.

About Pfeifer Heavy Machinery BV

Pfeifer Heavy Machinery was founded over 20 years ago in Groenlo, Netherlands and specialises in the purchase, sale, import and export of heavy construction vehicles and equipment. The company is run by owner and manager Gerrit Pfeifer, co-owner and manager Ralph Koehorst, and sales and transportation manager Kevin Stoteler. Together they lead a team of professionals who make use of their combined trade knowledge and experience to provide clients with a comprehensive range of services.

A wide range of machinery at any time

Pfeifer Heavy Machinery is able to locate specific machines or vehicles at the request of customers, and also keeps a constant stock of around 1,000 machines at its Groenlo site. Buyers can expect to find equipment such as lifts and mobile telescopic cranes, dump trucks, cement mixers, lighting columns, graders, trailers, excavators and bulldozers at any given time, and Pfeifer are able to take care of all legal, clerical administrative details on the client's behalf. The company also buy used equipment for resale and sellers can contact the sales team via the Pfeifer Machinery web page in the first instance. Pfeifer also offers finance services through its various financial partners, allowing buyers to purchase large machinery and equipment with ease.

A global network for heavy construction machines

Buyers can expect to find machinery for use in the construction industry that suits their budget, and Pfeifer Heavy Machinery BV is constantly adding to its stock. A multi-lingual sales team can deal with clients from almost any part of the world, and the company has developed its international reach considerably over the last 20 years. Since the year 2000 Pfeiffer Machinery has been more active on the digital network, and as well as a highly detailed and well organised web page the company can be found on several social networking sites such as Facebook, YouTube, Google, LinkedIn and Twitter. Prospective buyers are able to make use of its extensive online presence to see the latest machinery and equipment offered for sale, and the company aims to deliver any purchases to clients in any region. Prospective buyers can check the machinery they are interested in at the company's 25,000 sq meter premises and 6,000 sq meter warehouse for electronically powered lifts in the Netherlands. Buyers who can't visit the site can find in depth information on the Pfeifer BV website, and all equipment is catalogued, photographed and certified. A regular newsletter is available, giving subscribers information on the latest machinery for sale and ensuring that buyers won't miss out if they are interested in specific pieces of equipment. Pfeifer Machinery has a creative and experienced team that is able to overcome cultural barriers in order to bring heavy construction machinery to clients in any location, and the company continues to extend its international operations.

Activos Concursales is an online auction platform offering a vast range of goods that are the result of bankruptcy or liquidation proceedings. The platform enables companies to dispose of goods easily once a bankruptcy order has been made, and additional costs are not incurred by the seller. Fees for administration are charged to buyers, enabling sellers to achieve the best possible outcome from online auctions and sales. Activos Concursales SL provides a full assessment and valuation service for companies and individuals, and bankruptcy administrators can be requested on its website.

Open sales that attract more buyers

Anyone can bid for goods on the Activos Concursales platform, although a Spanish mobile phone number is required in order to receive texts. A wide selection of lots can be seen at any time. Listings include a location, description and photograph for each lot, and start and end times for sales. Sellers benefit from having their goods seen by a wider audience thanks to the internationally available portal, and can expect higher profits than might be realised in traditional bankruptcy or liquidation sales. Categories include cars, machinery, housing, furnishings and land, and specific lots might be anything from car park spaces to luxury yachts. Buyers simply make an offer in order to bid for items, and each listing clearly shows the amount of time remaining. Text and e mail alerts show if bids have been bettered, and allow bidders to increase their offers.

If goods fail to sell by direct bid, they can then be sold in online public auctions that take place at Madrid time. Successful bidders are responsible for collection and transportation of goods in the case of movable assets. Some of the recent lots which have been successfully sold on the Activos Concursales platform include city apartments, rural properties, industrial machinery such as welding equipment, hand and power tools, forklifts and cars.
